findings.title: Rounding errors
findings.description: The slope calculation will lose precision due to storing it as a uint, resulting in a rounding error of around 10^-12.

findings.title: Misuse of different call methods: call.value(), send() and transfer()
findings.description: The audit report highlights the misuse of different call methods, specifically call.value(), send(), and transfer(). This can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Integer rounding errors overflow underflow and related usage of SafeMath functions
findings.description: Rounding errors due to precision loss when storing slope as uint, potentially causing issues if auction parameters change.

findings.title: Race conditions such as reentrancy attacks and front running
findings.description: Vulnerability to race conditions including reentrancy attacks and front running.

findings.title: Misuse of block timestamps, assuming anything other than them being strictly increasing
findings.description: The contract assumes block timestamps to be strictly increasing which is not always the case.

findings.title: Contract softlocking attacks (DoS)
findings.description: A type of Denial-of-Service attack where a contract is intentionally put into a state where it cannot operate normally.

findings.title: Potential gas cost of functions being over the gas limit
findings.description: The gas cost of certain functions may exceed the gas limit, leading to potential issues with transaction execution.

findings.title: Missing function qualifiers and qualifier misuse
Fallback functions with a higher gas cost than allowed by a transfer or send call
findings.description: The contract contains fallback functions with a higher gas cost than allowed by a transfer or send call, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Code and contract interaction complexity
findings.description: The audit report highlights the complexity of code and contract interactions as a potential security risk.

findings.title: Overuse of transfers in a single transaction instead of using withdrawal patterns
findings.description: Using multiple transfers in a single transaction can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks, instead of implementing a withdrawal pattern.

findings.title: Insufficient analysis of function input requirements
findings.description: The audit report highlights the importance of analyzing function input requirements to prevent potential security vulnerabilities.
